Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice or Type B kantharos; white slip; interior glazed (fired reddish and worn); part of single band in added white; exterior reserved.
Curator's comments: The size of the sherd, the lack of diagnostic details and the absence of decoration on the exterior surface make it impossible to determine whether it came from a kantharos or a chalice. Chalice Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior. Given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice. Kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) also have very little decoration.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1359) (phase 2)
